DOC.brief_summary: The purpose study evaluate short-term efficacy safety Fluoxetine Japanese adult participant Major Depressive Disorder ( MDD ) .
DOC.brief_title: A Study Fluoxetine Major Depressive Disorder ( MDD ) Short-Term Dosing
DOC.criteria: Outpatient Japanese participant diagnose MDD Diagnosis moderate great severity MDD Agree abstain sexual activity use reliable method birth control Judged reliable ( agree keep appointment clinic visit undergo test examination require protocol ) Have previously expose fluoxetine ( LY110140 ) indication past Significant suicidal risk Have current previous diagnosis bipolar disorder , psychotic depression , schizophrenia psychotic disorder , anorexia , bulimia , obsessive compulsive disorder , posttraumatic stress disorder Have history substance abuse dependence within past 6 month , exclude caffeine nicotine Have initiate , stop , change type intensity psychotherapy within 6 week Have history electroconvulsive therapy ( ECT ) , transcranial magnetic stimulation ( TMS ) , vagus nerve stimulation ( VNS ) within 1 year Have treatment Monoamine oxidase inhibitor ( MAOI ) within 14 day Need use thioridazine pimozide study Have previously enrol , complete , withdrawn study Have positive urine drug screen drug abuse potential Female participant either pregnant , nursing , recently give birth , male participant plan partner become pregnant Have history seizure disorder Have frequent severe allergic reaction multiple medication Have serious unstable medical illness condition , psychological condition Participants deem ineligible investigator subinvestigator reason
